You are my son. Therefore, I have a natural affection for you. Out of love and in return for love, I intend to transfer some immovable property to you. I hereby give you this property as per the schedule mentioned below, i.e. the property as per my previous acquisition till today, including the vacant land as per the schedule below, measuring 53.77 sq.m., including the water resources, easement rights and customary rights of way, free of charge, worth Rs. 3,77,000/- in letters, and I hereby completely relinquish all rights I have in the said property from today and hereby transfer the said property to you. I have taken possession of the property with full rights. You shall pay all the taxes, duties, etc. due to the property from now on, and you, your sons, grandsons, and descendants, shall enjoy the property with all the rights of gift, sale, and enjoyment. I, my sons, and my descendants, shall settle all the encumbrances, I hereby give you this settlement deed, assuring you that the property is undisputed and unencumbered by any and all other circumstances, and that I have full authority to transfer the property to you. I hereby give you this settlement deed, assuring you that the details in this schedule are correct and that I have full authority to transfer the property to you. I hereby give you this settlement deed, assuring you that the property is unencumbered and unencumbered by any and all other circumstances, and Shed by:
Nampu Venkateswarl

The deed is written and given. The property is not a property assigned by the Government.
The provisions of A.P. Government Act 9/1977 do not apply to this property. The property is not a property of the Government. The property is not a property granted by the Government to them or to any Government institution.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 224 of 2026 dated 08/Jan/2026, executed by Bondala Rajulamma in favour of her son Bondhala Dhaaliraju, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 53.77Sq.Yds, comprised in survey number 319, situated in Velugubanda Grama Panchayath, Rajanagaram Mandal, within the District of East Godavari registered at sub-registrar office Rajanagaram is bounded as follows: North by: 22.0 Fts Site of Kondem Gangaraju South by: 22.0 Fts Site of Penumalla Satyanarayana East by: 22.0 Fts House of Tatapudi Aruna West by: 22.0 Fts Panchayat Road

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
